    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Duskwalker</h1>Duskwalkers are infused with the same energies as psychopomps. These ashen scions are reborn on the Material Plane to serve as guardians of the cycle of life and death.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Humanoid</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=14">Society</a></u>)</b>: DC 19<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=332">Duskwalker Ghost Hunter</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 4</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\PlanarScion_DuskwalkerGhostHunter.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\PlanarScion_DuskwalkerGhostHunter.png"></a><span alt="Neutral" class="traitalignment" title="Neutral">N</span><span alt="Medium" class="traitsize" title="Medium">Medium</span><span alt="Duskwalker Trait" class="trait" title="<i>Note from Nethys: This trait was not listed in the Glossary, its only use is as a Trait for some monsters.</i>"><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=257">Duskwalker</a></span><span alt="Human Trait" class="trait" title="A creature with this trait is a member of the human ancestry. Humans are a diverse array of people known for their adaptability. An ability with this trait can be used or selected only by humans."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=90">Human</a></span><span alt="Humanoid Trait" class="trait" title="Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=91">Humanoid</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 262</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +10; darkvision<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=1"><u>Common</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=20"><u>Necril</a></u><br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1"><u>Acrobatics</a></u> +10, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3"><u>Athletics</a></u> +8, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5"><u>Deception</a></u> +6, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=7"><u>Intimidation</a></u> +6, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=10"><u>Nature</a></u> +8, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=15"><u>Stealth</a></u> +12, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=16"><u>Survival</a></u> +8<br /><b>Str</b> +2, <b>Dex</b> +4, <b>Con</b> +1, <b>Int</b> +0, <b>Wis</b> +2, <b>Cha</b> +0<br /><b>Items</b> <a href="Weapons.aspx?ID=74"><u>composite longbow (20 arrows)</u></a>, <a href="Weapons.aspx?ID=27"><u>hatchet (2)</u></a>, <a href="Armor.aspx?ID=4"><u>leather armor</u></a><hr /><b>AC</b> 21 (22 against prey; see Hunt Prey), <b>Fort</b> +9, <b>Ref</b> +12, <b>Will</b> +10; +1 status to all saves vs. death effects<br /><b>HP</b> 56; <b>Immunities</b> effects that would transform their body or soul to an undead; <b>Resistances</b> negative energy 2<hr /><b>Speed</b> 25 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> hatchet +12 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=194"><u>sweep</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d6+5 slashing</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Ranged</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> composite longbow +14 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=174"><u>deadly 1d10</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=191"><u>propulsive</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=248"><u>range increment 100 feet</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=254"><u>reload 0</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=201"><u>volley 30 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d8+4 piercing</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Ranged</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> hatchet +14 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=194"><u>sweep</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=195"><u>thrown 10 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d6+5 slashing</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Ghost Hunter</b> The duskwalker’s weapons have the benefits of the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Equipment.aspx?ID=297"><i>ghost touch</i></a> property rune on attacks against incorporeal undead.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Hunt Prey</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  The duskwalker designates as its prey a single creature that it can see and hear or that it is Tracking. It gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when it Seeks its prey and a +2 circumstance bonus to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=16">Survival</a> checks when it Tracks its prey. It also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within its second range increment against its prey.<br /> Lastly, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=5">Deception</a> checks, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=7">Intimidation</a> checks, and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=15">Stealth</a> checks against its prey and to any check to Recall Knowledge about its prey, as well as a +1 circumstance bonus to AC against its prey’s attacks. The duskwalker can have only one prey designated at a time.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Hunted Shot</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  <b>Frequency</b> Once per round; <b>Effect</b> The duskwalker makes two longbow Strikes against its hunted prey. If both Strikes hit, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.</span><h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=81">Planar Scion</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=333">Aasimar</a></td><td>5</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=332">Duskwalker</a></td><td>4</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=331">Tiefling</a></td><td>3</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=81">Planar Scion</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 262</i></a><br />Many immortals dwell upon the other planes of the Great Beyond. Some are benevolent and kindly, like angels. Others are cruel and destructive, like demons. And some flt roles outside of morality, like psychopomps. It’s far from unheard of that mortals and immortals alike become entangled romantically, and the children of such engagements carry a supernatural element in their bloodlines for generations to follow. After the first generation, this otherworldly influence usually lies dormant, but now and then, the influence can manifest strongly in descendants many years later. These inheritors of extraplanar legacies are known collectively as planar scions.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> Other Planar Scions</h3>As many types of planar scions exist as planes of existence, and even then there are significant differences between scions depending on the exact nature of their extraplanar forebears. Angelic scions are known as aasimars, fiendish scions are called tieflings, and monitor scions are urobians.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Planar Origins</h3>Most planar scions are the distant descendants of some immortal progenitor far back in the family’s bloodline. Others, however, may be the result of powerful planar energies, magical curses, or even the intervention of a deity or demigod.</span>

                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
</body>
</html>
